<JD_START>
Job Title: Product & Prototype Evaluation Technician

Location: Anderson, SC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Product & Prototype Evaluation Technician in Anderson, SC. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our Research & Development (R&D) and Offering Team to evaluate prototypes and products related to power distribution equipment. Your primary responsibility will be to ensure that these products meet quality standards and specifications through rigorous testing and evaluation processes. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for delivering high-quality products.

Responsibilities

Collaborate with the R&D and Offering Team to understand project requirements and objectives.Perform thorough evaluations of prototypes and products to ensure they comply with UL 857 standards, local regulations, and company protocols.Conduct a variety of tests, including functional, performance, durability, and reliability tests, on power distribution equipment.Provide support to our test technicians by assisting with test setups, data collection, and troubleshooting.Document test procedures, results, and observations accurately and thoroughly.Analyze test data and identify any deviations from specifications or quality standards.Collaborate with engineers, designers, and other team members to troubleshoot issues and propose solutions.Participate in the development and refinement of testing procedures and protocols.Maintain testing equipment and ensure it is calibrated and functioning properly.Provide feedback on product design, performance, and usability to support continuous improvement efforts.Adhere to all safety protocols and regulations while performing testing activities, ensuring strict compliance with UL 857 standards and other relevant local regulations.

Qualifications

Technical certification or experience in a relevant field (e.g., engineering technology, electronics, mechanical engineering).Prior experience in product testing, prototype evaluation, or quality assurance preferred.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Detail-oriented with a high level of accuracy in documentation and data analysis.Methodical and organized approach to work, with the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.Knowledge of standards such as UL 857, National Electrical Code (NEC), and familiarity with local regulations applicable to the industry.Excellent communication and collaboration skills.Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.Familiarity with testing equipment and tools commonly used in product evaluation.Willingness to learn and adapt to new technologies and testing methodologies.

Experience Required

3+ years of experience in Design within the manufacturing environment or directly related experience. Experience with power distribution applications and/or the data center industry is advantageous.Experience designing mild steel sheet welded assemblies, extruded/injection molded plastic parts and assemblies.Knowledge of DFM (Design for Manufacturing) DFA (Design for Assembly) DFE (Design for Environment).Knowledge of Process flow, PFMEA, Control plan, Standard Operating Procedure preparation.Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite. Smartsheet, and other business applications are desirable. Demonstrated competence in communication and problem-solving.

PHYSICAL & ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS

No special physical demands

Time Travel Required

20%

The successful candidate will embrace Vertiv’s Core Principals & Behaviors to help execute our Strategic Priorities. 

OUR CORE PRINCIPALS: Safety. Integrity. Respect. Teamwork. Diversity & Inclusion.

OUR STRATEGIC PRIORITIES

Customer FocusOperational ExcellenceHigh-Performance CultureInnovationFinancial Strength

OUR BEHAVIORS

Own ItAct With UrgencyFoster a Customer-First MindsetThink Big and ExecuteLead by ExampleDrive Continuous ImprovementLearn and Seek Out Development

At Vertiv, we offer the stability of a global leader in a growing industry and the opportunity of a startup. We design, manufacture and service the mission-critical infrastructure technologies for vital applications in data centers, communication networks and commercial and industrial environments. With 27,000 people and more than $5.5 billion in sales, a strong customer base and global reach in nearly 70 countries, our move to establish a standalone business enables us to deliver greater value to our customers and create new opportunities for our people.

Vertiv is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. We promote equal opportunities for all with respect to hiring, terms of employment, mobility, training, compensation, and occupational health, without discrimination as to age, race, color, religion, creed, sex, pregnancy status (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression (including transgender status or sexual stereotypes), genetic information, citizenship status, national origin, protected veteran status, political affiliation, or disability. If you have a disability and are having difficulty accessing or using this website to apply for a position, you can request help by sending an email to  help.join@vertivco.com . If you are interested in applying or learning more about this role, please visit the company’s career page located on Vertiv.com/Careers

Work Authorization

No calls or agencies please. Vertiv will only employ those who are legally authorized to work in the United States. This is not a position for which sponsorship will be provided. Individuals with temporary visas such as E, F-1, H-1, H-2, L, B, J, or TN or who need sponsorship for work authorization now or in the future, are not eligible for hire.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
